record.title: MAKING MAJORITY PARTY APPOINTMENTS FOR THE 110TH CONGRESS
record.narrative:
MAKING MAJORITY PARTY APPOINTMENTS FOR THE 110TH CONGRESS -- (Senate - March 31, 2008)

[Page: S2250]

speaking.paragraph: I send a resolution to the desk and ask for its immediate consideration.

record.chair: The clerk will report the resolution by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A resolution (S. Res. 492) amending majority party membership on the Select Committee on Ethics for the remainder of the 110th Congress.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the resolution.

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that the resolution be agreed to, and that the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table without interviewing action.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The resolution (S. Res. 492) was agreed to, as follows:

Resolved, That Senate Resolution 27 (110th Congress) is amended, effective January 1, 2008, by striking all from "ETHICS:" through "72a-1f" and inserting "ETHICS: Mrs. Boxer (Chairman), Mr. Pryor, and Mr. Salazar".
